fields.description:
We're using pull requests for code reviews, and have adopted a convention of terminating each source file with a trailing newline. However when viewing the diff of a file, it is not clear whether that trailing newline is present or not (the last line is simply the last line).

I'm not sure if this applies to _changes_ to the presence of a trailing newline (I know SourceTree handles those), but when a new file is added, there is no indication of whether it is present.
fields.summary: Trailing newline not shown in pull request diff (BB-9301)

fields.description:
I could image a scenario where someone accidentally puts sensitive information into a commit message, and would want to eliminate it from the history.  One can "rebase" a branch, which could permanently delete that commit from the repository history, but the "Recent activity" display on the "Overview" tab would still show the commit message from when it was originally pushed.

It would be handy to have a button in the settings called "Purge recent activity" which would remove any such sensitive commit messages.
fields.summary: "Purge recent activity" function (BB-9385)

fields.description:
go to any mercurial repository with at least two commits, like https://bitbucket.org/site/pyflakes3k/commits/all.

type {{tip~1..tip}} into the [Find commits] input, get shortlog for the appropriate commits.

type {{tip~1::tip}} into the [Find commits] input, get "No commits match your search query."

change both occurrences of {{%253A}} in the url to naked colons, get shortlog for the appropriate commits.
fields.summary: url encoding issue in /commits breaks the "::" operator (BB-9300)

fields.description:
Well trying to review a very large pull request (70 files), I found the performance of the website to be utterly unbearable (in Chrome). I believe this is because there are simply too many items on the screen (and possibly javascript events, didn't look). If the pull request were divided into pages, say 20-30 files at a time, this might be less problematic.

In the case of this particular pull request, the last 20 or so files are never diffed, they just time out. When I click the "retry" link, they are never loaded. Peaking at the network tab, it looks like the diffs for the last 20 files are being returned when i click "Retry", but they are never loaded onto the page, for whatever reason. There are no errors in the JS console.
fields.summary: Feature/Bug: Add paging for pull requests comprised of many files (BB-9354)

fields.description:
[followup for BCLOUD-5420.  Thanks for the willingness to support math!]

I've created a repo to test the restructuredtext math support:\\
https://bitbucket.org/cbensf/test-math/\\
docutils marks inline and display math with class="math but they're not rendered,\\
at least in Chrome.  Console says:

[blocked] The page at https://bitbucket.org/cbensf/test-math/ ran insecure content from http://cdn.mathjax.org/mathjax/latest/MathJax.js?config=TeX-MML-AM_HTMLorMML.\\
[blocked] The page at https://bitbucket.org/cbensf/test-math/ ran insecure content from http://cdn.mathjax.org/mathjax/latest/config/TeX-MML-AM_HTMLorMML.js. ...and so on...

Accessing bitbucket via http redirects to https, so can't even try that.

=> You need to use HTTPS address of mathjax CDN: http://www.mathjax.org/resources/faqs/#problem-https

According to http://docutils.sourceforge.net/docs/user/config.html#math-output\\
this can be configured as:

[html4css1 writer]\\
math-output: MathJax https://c328740.ssl.cf1.rackcdn.com/mathjax/latest/MathJax.js?config=TeX-MML-AM_HTMLorMML

(the url while ugly is "stable and safe to use" — see mathjax FAQ above)
fields.summary: MathJax doesn't work because it's loaded via http

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

There is no functionality to delete Pull request in case if any sensitive data is is being committed.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 * You may accidentally commit something like a password in a fork of a repo
 * Create a Pull Request
 * No option to delete the Pull request

h3. Expected Results

There should be functionality to delete the Pull request
h3. Actual Results

Currently, there is no way to remove that PR once created resulting in your sensitive data being shown in the PR diff forever.
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Deletion of a Pull request is not possible

fields.description:
Currently, in Bitbucket, you can reference other issues using the #\d+ notation, for example: BCLOUD-8051, BCLOUD-5633 (arbitrary issues).

One interesting feature could be linking issues in other tracker by prepending the repository name to the notation: tortoisehg/thg/#470.  Which in this case, would become something like:\\
[tortoisehg/thg/#470|https://bitbucket.org/tortoisehg/thg/issue/470/workbench-slow-working-directory-selection].  With a dash if it was closed.

An interesting complement to this, is that, an issue created inside a user/team, would preferentially reference a repository hosted by the same user/team.  thg/#470 on the "site" team, would reference site/thg/#470 instead of referencing the one in the previous example.
fields.summary: Better cross-repository issue tracker linking

fields.description:
[Bitbucket documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/BITBUCKET/Display%2BREADME%2Btext%2Bon%2Bthe%2Boverview%3Fsrc%3Dsearch#DisplayREADMEtextontheoverview-Filenamingandprecedence] says

bq. If you have a defined a setup.py file in your repository's root, Bitbucket parses files without an extension or that use the .txt extension as reST also.


[This repo|https://bitbucket.org/roman.neuhauser/txtless/overview] proves the manual wrong.
fields.summary: README.txt in Python projects rendered improperly

fields.description:
The 'delete group' functionality appears not to do anything.

Expect results: Performing a 'delete group' operation would cause the deleted group to no longer be included in the list of groups visible in the relevant account's management page.

Actual results: Clicking the 'Delete group' button in my account's list of groups results in a confirmation dialog asking me whether I am sure I want to delete the group. This dialog contains an OK button. Clicking this OK button dismisses the dialog, thus revealing the list of groups again, which is unchanged.

Forcing a refresh of the groups list, by visiting a different management page then returning to the groups list, results in display of the same list of groups, still containing the supposedly-deleted group.

Logging out and logging back in, then viewing the list of groups again, results in display of the same groups list, still including the supposedly-deleted group.

There appears to be no way to cause a group to no longer be included in this list.
fields.summary: 'Delete group' does not delete the group

fields.description:
Following [this|https://twitter.com/gnclmorais/status/359678640386093058] discussion, I would like to suggest simpler URLs for the most recent version of a file.

For example, the simple URL of [this link|https://bitbucket.org/equalsraf/vim-qt/src/4065223b790f118806fc7ac863a0acf0ef740c34/README.md%3Fat%3Dmaster] would be [this one|https://bitbucket.org/equalsraf/vim-qt/README.md]. {{master}} branch would be the default branch.
fields.summary: Simpler URL for the most recent version of a file

fields.description:
Scenario: We had a feature branch with a pull request that was declined.  After the decline, I went to the "Feature branch" tab (as a repo admin user) and selected the gear icon and "Delete branch" for that feature branch that was associated with the pull request.

The branch appeared to be deleted properly, however it still continued to be listed in the branch menu from both the Source and Commits tabs.

Clicking on the branch link from the menu gave a 404 Error page.

I initially thought this might be related to issue # 3583, however even after restarting my browser, the branch still showed up in the menu on the aforementioned pages (tested on Safari and Firefox for Mac).

Interestingly, I just repeated the delete branch action for a feature branch that was not associated with a pull request and it immediately disappeared from the source/commit branch menu list.  So not sure if this is just an intermittent thing or whether the fact that the branch that was deleted was associated with a declined pull request was what prevented it from being removed from the branch menus.

Let me know if you require any more info.
fields.summary: Deleting branch from Bitbucket (sometimes) doesn't remove it from the branch menu in the source/commit tabs (BB-9240)

fields.description: In the signup form, if one tries to choose a username containing nothing but letters, but with some non-English letters, then the error message "This value must contain only letters, numbers and underscores." is displayed. This is obviously incorrect. The error message should say "only English letters", or else all letters should be allowed.
fields.summary: Clarify that ASCII characters are required on the username field (BB-9239)

fields.description:
A file that is removed is displayed as a line-by-line removal in bitbucket. In some cases, that is helpful, but in others, it just ends up cluttering the view.

As it currently stands, it seems ambiguous since it looks more like the file was emptied than that it was removed.
fields.summary: Better UI for showing added/removed files (BB-9238)

fields.description:
I sometimes work on two or three projects in a week. Each week I need to fill out timesheets.

It would be nice if I could look at the commit logs, and give myself a reminder about when I worked on things. (i.e. : if the commit time was 1pm, then I can assume that I worked for about 4 hours that day on a specific project).

Push time doesn't matter to me at all, btw. The history of the project commits are more important.
fields.summary: would like to see commit times in the Dashboard (BB-9248)

fields.summary: Red and green highlighting inconsistent when in diff view (BB-9204)

fields.description:
Looking at https://bitbucket.org/philpem/suds I see "Fork of suds", which links to another page which also has a link "Fork of suds".

I suggest something like "Fork of jurko/suds" or "Fork of suds (by jurko)"
fields.summary: "Fork of" should include username (BB-9203)

fields.description: See [BB-9194|https://bitbucket.atlassian.net/browse/BB-9194]
fields.summary: SSH Key add email should tell you what user added the key (BB-9194)

fields.description:
Using Firefox 23.0.1, many of the toolbar and other icons are missing.

Here's a screenshot to illustrate:

!http://imageshack.us/a/img542/8805/6pry.png!

Presumably this is not a problem that is affecting all users. Any idea why it might be affecting me?
fields.summary: Missing toolbar icons

fields.description:
In the new Admin > Branch Management screen for a repo, it seems that the "Add" button doesn't always get properly enabled when a branch value is supplied.

For instance, in the "Prevent history re-writes (rebase) on these branches" field, I typed "*" (and selected the "* (all branches)" menu popup), but even after doing this, the "Add" button was still disabled/greyed out.

Typing (and selecting) "master" appears to have enabled the Add button and then I was able to go back and change the branch to "*", but this should work properly in the first place.

This was on the latest version of Chrome on MacOSX.
fields.summary: Add button not always properly enabled when branch is specified in admin branch management screen (BB-9202)

fields.description:
It would be great if the Readme file displayed on a repository's overview page could be automatically parsed to generate links to change-sets in the repository and issues in the issue tracker for the project, much like comments in issue are, etc.

That way if my Readme contained for example the text "issue BCLOUD-18" anywhere in it, then that text would be linked to issue BCLOUD-18 in the tracker for my project when the Readme is presented on the overview page.  Same for change-set hashes.
fields.summary: Linkify issues and changesets in READMEs (BB-9488)

fields.description:
When creating an issue in my _own_ repository, I always get notified by email about the creation of the issue. It happens both when I am the assignee and when the assignee was left blank.

Because I obviously know that I created the issue, this email is completely superfluous.\\
Could you disable that or create an option to ignore it for this case?
fields.summary: Creating an issue in own repository notifies the creator (BB-9200)

fields.description:
When searching in the commits the view, including the search box, gets updated via ajax.\\
This causes the search box to disappear during typing.
fields.summary: Searching Commits (BB-9199)

fields.description:
Oftentimes we're using the [gitflow|http://nvie.com/git-model/] process

It would be great if you could specify colors for branches - such as "develop"/"master" etc, to be used in the commits page. This would be very useful in the branching visualization, and allow for quick grasp of the work process.
fields.summary: Colors for branches

fields.description:
Please add Livecode as a supported language.\\
Files use extension .livecode and are basically text files with image and other binary information.

http://runrev.com/
fields.summary: Please add Livecode language support (BB-9198)

fields.description:
Hi,

I push a .hex file which is generated by avr-gcc a few days ago.Its size is 5.63KB.

When I download it,I find its size has changed to 5.51KB!This file can no more be used.

So I have to make it to a .7z file ,then push it.But this file is too big,and my net speed is very slow.

My TortoiseGit  version is 1.8.4.0 ,git version is 1.8.1.msysgit.1.

What Shall I do?Please forgive my bad English.

thx~

*
fields.summary: .Hex file was modified by Repository

fields.description:
The follows method on the user endpoint returns deleted repositories if a redirect url was supplied when they were deleted. Only after a call to a repositories endpoint method you find out it was deleted by receiving a 404 error. If no redirect url was supplied, they do not show up after the deletion.

I consider this a bug partly because there seems to be no way to find out that the repository no longer exists other than waiting for the 404 and partly because the other methods on the user endpoint do not return these repositories.

I see two possible fixes:

* remove all deleted repositories from the responses (API users would no longer see the redirect url in the 'website' property)
* provide the information that the repository was deleted (read_only or state would be a good place)
fields.summary: user/follows API method returns deleted repositories (BB-9197)

fields.description:
We created a new repo as the new one was a complete rewrite of the old one.

We should have made a branch but thats how it went on.

How do we move issues from the old one to new one?
fields.summary: Transfer issues from one repo to other.

fields.description:
This is easiest illustrated with an example:

# Go to this {{tip}} url: https://bitbucket.org/jeroenp/besharp.net/src/tip/Native/Delphi/Apps/Console/GenerateGroupProjConsoleProject
# Now click on any of the source files
# Observe the url does not contain {{tip}} but the revision ID for that file. I'd like a way to browse to the {{tip}} version of that file with {{tip}} in the URL for easier documentation referencing.
fields.summary: When browsing the `tip` source code of a repository, the browser does not remember `tip` (BB-5640)

fields.description:
The purpose of having voting on issues is so that users who are tempted to post "+1" comments will refrain from doing so. But right now, the "Vote for this issue" tag is so well hidden that you'd never know it was there unless you were _looking_ for it.

It's on a panel off to the right (a place we're generally trained not to look, since that's where ads tend to be), and it's in the middle of a bunch of other text. It should be at the top of the issue, among the actual information about the issue.
fields.summary: Issue voting needs to be more prominent.

fields.description:
После форка репозитария, уже две недели пытается его склонировать\\
http://dkuser.bitbucket.org/
fields.summary: Бесконечное клонирование

fields.description:
Is there a limit of rendering 100 items inside a _ul_ tag list?\\
I'm using the Creole wiki syntax.

See: https://bitbucket.org/axelclk/symja.ajax/wiki/Symbols\\
after the "Greater" keyword the rendering changes?

I would like to create the documentation of available functions inside the wiki.
fields.summary: Creole wiki: is there a limit of 100 in generating items inside a _ul_ tag list?

fields.description:
Is it possible to add a default git ignore dropdown on the creation of repositories. This would be helpful for teams that are getting used to git and need help working out what to ignore.

My thought are the you would select your IDE from a list and from that the ignore would be copied directly into the repo so that i would come with the first clone already set up and working.

I have run into the case before where someone had forgotten to add the ignore file for eclipse and then we imported the project into another computer and had to change the build paths because that was not being ignored it screwed up all other installations.

Hope this can be implemented soon :D
fields.summary: Add Default Git Ignore On Repository Creation

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:

# New issue
# Click on Choose files button
# A new line is appended with the file name
# Click again on Choose files button
# A new line is NOT appended, but the file names are changed.

The multiple attachments uploading doesn't work. Hope it will be solved soon.
fields.summary: Uploading multiple attachments in issues

fields.description:
I have the exact same request as [this guy|https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/182534/add-a-wiki-to-a-bitbucket-team-profile-page] , but I couldn't find a created issue for it.

I have quite a few projects belonging to a team account, with more being added. However a lot of documentation is more specific to the entire team rather than the different projects. The natural place to put this would be in a wiki tied to the team account.

Another option could be to assign a repository as the "team repository" so its README overview, wiki and issue tracker appears on the team profile page.

*EDIT:* A third option would be the option to make the team [static site|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/BITBUCKET/Publishing%2Ba%2BWebsite%2Bon%2BBitbucket] private so only team-members with read access can see it.
fields.summary: Wiki for team accounts (BB-9196)
